intro: Celmisia verbascifolia subsp. membranacea, commonly known as the membranaceous celmisia, is a herbaceous perennial native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and rocky areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
